commit_message:
Simplify our warning suppressions

The message filter is a regex, so any prefix of the message will
suffice. This allows us to also drop a new message seen on CentOS 8:

   CryptographyDeprecationWarning: Python 3.6 is no longer
   supported by the Python core team. Therefore, support for
   it is deprecated in cryptography. The next release of
   cryptography (40.0) will be the last to support Python 3.6.

Change-Id: I84dc4dd72d88b70c0dc641767527eb4fadb2403e

commit_message:
Fixes for tox4

- Replace long deprecated whitelist_externals with allowlist_externals.
- Drop basepython option that is no longer needed.
- Invoke bash scripts with explicit bash command instead of allowlisting
  every single script.

Change-Id: I2b70ebb3b1ee94ad75e46295d788312c5e183748

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Id061881b07097a2a641646b90bbc84416fbc17bd

commit_message:
Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I5308e80d926050e3acb89ae3e94c7b43559891c2

commit_message:
Merge ovs-db and ovs-vswitchd in one Daemonset

There is no usecase in which ovs-db and ovs-vswitchd run on
different nodes.
In terms of version upgrade, ovs-db and ovs-vswitchd should be
upgraded together in every node.
This commit deploys ovs-db and ovs-vswitchd in one daemonset.

Change-Id: I791b9f7abfd3ca838dc2adfaa6c606bb1c88d19d

commit_message:
Introduce new option ngs_save_configuration

This new option allows to optionally disable configuration
saving, which can significantly speed up the overall process.

The default behaviour is unchanged: if the option is not set,
configuration is saved after each change.

Change-Id: Ida07397bbc9c15248aa6bceab268e63289048d07

commit_message:
Add support for JWKS based OAuth Token validation.

Keycloak only enables the introspection API when using a 'confidential'
client.  This means that for user initiated OAuth2 tokens the user would
need to know the secrets for a client (ie the confidential piece).

With Keycloak to use a 'public' client, where the user doesn't need to
know a client secret, you need to use a JWKS to validate the JWT tokens
instead of the introspection endpoint.

By setting KeystoneOpenIdcVerifyMethod to 'jwks' and
KeystoneOpenIdcVerifyJwksUri to the published URI for the JSON Web Key Set
you can switch over to 'local' verification of the token using signed data
in the JWT.

Change-Id: Ie2f0d09db08956b7646e4d72bb190f04f8d2ea93
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/711646
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/27/711927/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: KeystoneOpenIdcVerifyMethod: type: string default: 'introspection' description: >- Mechanism used to verify OIDC tokens. constraints: - allowed_values: ['introspection', 'jwks'] KeystoneOpenIdcVerifyJwksUri: type: string default: '' description: >- The JWKS URL on which the Identity Provider publishes the keys used to sign its JWT access tokens. keystone::federation::openidc::openidc_verify_method: get_param: KeystoneOpenIdcVerifyMethod keystone::federation::openidc::openidc_verify_jwks_uri: get_param: KeystoneOpenIdcVerifyJwksUri

commit_message:
Make the Ansible strategy configurable

In our effort to improve the performance and reliability
of our usage of Ansible. Let's make the Strategies we use
configurable.

There are some tasks that do not work well with tripleo_free
this change will allow granular configuration of the strategy
for the playbooks that are being executed.

Change-Id: I6734a28a8e51fd2ae78d6591d4fb70c80adb72e6

Disable all container healthchecks by default

This is a first step in order to complete the "Cleaning container
healthchecks" spec[1].

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/xena/healthcheck-cleanup.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-specs/+/803152
Partially-Implements: bp clean-container-healthchecks
Change-Id: Ib90da51e47607a2041c62947fbfe168833c3d0d8

commit_message:
Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

As we are cleaning up the c7 jobs and obselete featuresets [1].
This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

Change-Id: Ia7d3a447ddc631c1fc21adcd561fc2b65285a5c0

Change-Id: I0a0203d8edd71c2fd1a5b08efdba048ee28cb182
'}]
commit_message:
Allow large block size to create a swap file

Currently we use 1MB block to allocate a swap file. However this is not
efficient when the swap file is large(~10GiB for example), and causes
very slow progress of that task and timeout eventually.

This change introduces a new parameter to define size of the swap file
in Gigabytes. When this parameter is used, 1GB block size is used
instead to avoid overhead.

Change-Id: I0a0203d8edd71c2fd1a5b08efdba048ee28cb182
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/09/825209/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: description: | Amount of swap space to allocate in megabytes swap_size_gigabytes: type: string description: | Amount of swap space to allocate in gigabytes. This parameter overrides the swap_size_megabytes parameter. Use this to create a large swap file. default: ''conditions: swap_size_in_gigabytes: not: {equals: [{get_param: swap_size_gigabytes}, '']} dd if=/dev/zero of=$swap_path count=$swap_size bs=$swap_block_size - name: swap_block_count description: Amount of swap space to allocate (block counts) - name: swap_block_size description: Amount of swap space to allocate (block size) default: '1M' swap_size: if: - swap_size_in_gigabytes - {get_param: swap_size_gigabytes} - {get_param: swap_size_megabytes} swap_block_size: if: - swap_size_in_gigabytes - '1G' - '1M'
deleted_lines: description: Amount of swap space to allocate in megabytes dd if=/dev/zero of=$swap_path count=$swap_size_megabytes bs=1M - name: swap_size_megabytes description: Amount of swap space to allocate in megabytes swap_size_megabytes: {get_param: swap_size_megabytes}

commit_message:
Allow operators to update package after registration

Allow operators to update package after satellite registration in
order to benefit from updates that are not yet included in an overcloud
image that would've been released between two images.  This assumes
the satellite views (or the equivalent in other products) are manually
synced and newer packages would be available in any of the repositories.

Change-Id: I2fc9677c7ab4eded0ddcdd22ee7d6b952ab179ee

subject: Nova: Add support for initial_*_allocation_ratio
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-08-02 23:40:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/9df7a257be4df88b10023e1b4fa57606b8566866', 'message': 'Nova: Add support for initial_*_allocation_ratio

This introduces the new NovaUseInitialAllocationRatios parameter which
makes the initial_*_allocation_ratio parameters used instead of
the *_allocation_ratio parameters.
The initial_*_allocation_ratio parameters were added during the Stein
cycle[1], and if these parameters used instead of *_allocation_ratio,
nova updates allocation ratios in resource provider records only when
it initially creates the records in Placement. This allows operators
to update allocation ratios directly using Placement API call rather
than updating each *_allocation_ratio parameter in nova.conf.

[1] 08f3ae960623c94bdd997cacb3e81f04b4bbba69

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/803214
Change-Id: I87a2d22abc13395ed30e6d4673d30e590a31c5a7

commit_message:
Nova: Add support for initial_*_allocation_ratio

This introduces the new NovaUseInitialAllocationRatios parameter which
makes the initial_*_allocation_ratio parameters used instead of
the *_allocation_ratio parameters.
The initial_*_allocation_ratio parameters were added during the Stein
cycle[1], and if these parameters used instead of *_allocation_ratio,
nova updates allocation ratios in resource provider records only when
it initially creates the records in Placement. This allows operators
to update allocation ratios directly using Placement API call rather
than updating each *_allocation_ratio parameter in nova.conf.

[1] 08f3ae960623c94bdd997cacb3e81f04b4bbba69

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/803214
Change-Id: I87a2d22abc13395ed30e6d4673d30e590a31c5a7

Setting this parameter to false allows operators to update allocation ratios directly in Placement instead of updating allocation_ratio options in nova.conf. default: false tags: - role_specific use_initial_allocation_ratio: NovaUseInitialAllocationRatios cpu_allocation_ratio: NovaCPUAllocationRatio ram_allocation_ratio: NovaRAMAllocationRatio disk_allocation_ratio: NovaDiskAllocationRatio NovaUseInitialAllocationRatios: {get_param: NovaUseInitialAllocationRatios} - {get_attr: [RoleParametersValue, value, use_initial_allocation_ratio]} - nova::initial_cpu_allocation_ratio: {get_attr: [RoleParametersValue, value, cpu_allocation_ratio]} # if libvirt_file_backed_memory_enabled we have to set ram allocation ratio to 1.0 nova::initial_ram_allocation_ratio: if: - libvirt_file_backed_memory_enabled - '1.0' - {get_attr: [RoleParametersValue, value, ram_allocation_ratio]} nova::initial_disk_allocation_ratio: {get_attr: [RoleParametersValue, value, disk_allocation_ratio]} - nova::cpu_allocation_ratio: {get_attr: [RoleParametersValue, value, cpu_allocation_ratio]} # if libvirt_file_backed_memory_enabled we have to set ram allocation ratio to 1.0 nova::initial_ram_allocation_ratio: if: - libvirt_file_backed_memory_enabled - '1.0' - {get_attr: [RoleParametersValue, value, ram_allocation_ratio]} nova::disk_allocation_ratio: {get_attr: [RoleParametersValue, value, disk_allocation_ratio]} - if:

commit_message:
init-runonce: Migrate to ECDSA keys

OpenSSH 8.8 has dropped support for RSA SHA-1 keys.
ECDSA is FIPS approved, so probably it's a better
direction than just changing to SHA-256.

Change-Id: Id06d9d8912d9677dbe0f5a666f43a209664c94b4
(cherry picked from commit d2bc0b42aabda32084f4203bd569c1f8933d51d9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/75/869175/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ ! -f ~/.ssh/id_ecdsa.pub ]; then ssh-keygen -t ecdsa -N '' -f ~/.ssh/id_ecdsaif [ -r ~/.ssh/id_ecdsa.pub ]; then $KOLLA_OPENSTACK_COMMAND keypair create --public-key ~/.ssh/id_ecdsa.pub mykey
deleted_lines: if [ ! -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub ]; then ssh-keygen -t rsa -N '' -f ~/.ssh/id_rsaif [ -r ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub ]; then $KOLLA_OPENSTACK_COMMAND keypair create --public-key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub mykey

commit_message:
packages: add tzdata to ubuntu package list

Jammy Jellfish (22.04 LTS) doesn't have tzdata installed by default
It's needed for bind mounting /etc/localtime

Change-Id: Iefeafc7d2e6f6025acd0a8bcacd1434a48e7cda4
(cherry picked from commit 1fb0e56697d13ea6d044b45664e53432f2a5d22b)

subject: SQLAlchemy 2.0 Support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-07 18:00:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/e277616700e2f27eeaeba04c660d3394ff64fe33', 'message': "Initial SQLAlchemy 2.0 prep

Primarily remove the workaround added in
Ia6d512ff2ae417bab938cb095fbb0884d195010a which added
continued use of autocommit, which is incompatible with
SQLAlchemy 2.0.

Also set the environment for unit tests to report compatability
warnings, although it appears none are being reported at this time.

Also cuts out the db upgrade cruft to only use the online database
migration code through oslo_db's enginefacade, which has the smarts
to handle online or offline migrations.

For the record, locally this passed py3 unit tests with
pre-release SQLAlchemy 2.0.0b1.

Change-Id: Ic88eb9dec5fddc924a72d9a23c17a304954ebf46

"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2022-11-01 16:58:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/51264764aa1b9a36763cda1b0fa15cb3190a7031', 'message': "SQLAlchemy 2.0 prep

Primarily remove the workaround added in
Ia6d512ff2ae417bab938cb095fbb0884d195010a which added
continued use of autocommit, which is incompatible with
SQLAlchemy 2.0.

Also set the environment for unit tests to report compatability
warnings, although it appears none are being reported at this time.

Also cuts out the db upgrade cruft to only use the online database
migration code through oslo_db's enginefacade, which has the smarts
to handle online or offline migrations.

And then, retools unit/functional test data storage to utlize sqlite,
and in that re-tooled the queries to prevent locking conditions
which could exist with queries, and some additional refactoring/cleanup.

Also, don't mock and test time.sleep().

Additionally, it looks like we have discovered the root cause of the
memory/connection leakage issue which has been observed, due to the
way lists of nodes are processed/returned.

Story: 2009727
Task: 44132
Change-Id: Ic88eb9dec5fddc924a72d9a23c17a304954ebf46

has been modified for ironic-inspector.

"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2022-12-06 19:45:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/218000bc47c929211286a8cc8c6ce35011c8528c', 'message': "SQLAlchemy 2.0 Support

Primarily remove the workaround added in
Ia6d512ff2ae417bab938cb095fbb0884d195010a which added
continued use of autocommit, which is incompatible with
SQLAlchemy 2.0.

Also set the environment for unit tests to report compatability
warnings, although it appears none are being reported at this time.

Also cuts out the db upgrade cruft to only use the online database
migration code through oslo_db's enginefacade, which has the smarts
to handle online or offline migrations.

And then, retools unit/functional test data storage to utlize sqlite,
and in that re-tooled the queries to prevent locking conditions
which could exist with queries, and some additional refactoring/cleanup.

Also, don't mock and test time.sleep().

Additionally, it looks like we have discovered the root cause of the
memory/connection leakage issue which has been observed, due to the
way lists of nodes are processed/returned.

This change was based upon the work in
I506da42a9891a245831f325e34bec92e0a3f33f0 which is included in
this commit as the entire database structure and interaction
has been modified for ironic-inspector.

Co-Authored-By: aarefiev <aarefiev@mirantis.com>

Task: 44132
Change-Id: Ic88eb9dec5fddc924a72d9a23c17a304954ebf46

commit_message:
SQLAlchemy 2.0 Support

Primarily remove the workaround added in
Ia6d512ff2ae417bab938cb095fbb0884d195010a which added
continued use of autocommit, which is incompatible with
SQLAlchemy 2.0.

Also set the environment for unit tests to report compatability
warnings, although it appears none are being reported at this time.

Also cuts out the db upgrade cruft to only use the online database
migration code through oslo_db's enginefacade, which has the smarts
to handle online or offline migrations.

And then, retools unit/functional test data storage to utlize sqlite,
and in that re-tooled the queries to prevent locking conditions
which could exist with queries, and some additional refactoring/cleanup.

Also, don't mock and test time.sleep().

Additionally, it looks like we have discovered the root cause of the
memory/connection leakage issue which has been observed, due to the
way lists of nodes are processed/returned.

This change was based upon the work in
I506da42a9891a245831f325e34bec92e0a3f33f0 which is included in
this commit as the entire database structure and interaction
has been modified for ironic-inspector.

Co-Authored-By: aarefiev <aarefiev@mirantis.com>
Story: 2009727
Task: 44132
Change-Id: Ic88eb9dec5fddc924a72d9a23c17a304954ebf46

commit_message:
Remove lib/neutron-legacy leftovers

In [1] we finally got rid of the unfinished lib/neutron module and kept
only lib/neutron-legacy. It's renamed to lib/neutron now and it's the
only neutron related module in Devstack.
So this patch removes leftovers related to the old lib/neutron-legacy.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/865014

Change-Id: I2a856b15eda992f0e78ee8eff65f39646e24c936

commit_message:
Fix exceeding retries

Connector is not created with every request, but long-lived.
As the result retries run out when using sushy for longer
and resulting in permanent failure where another retry or so
should be enough. Fix this by counting retries per request.

Also fix and update log message for clarity.

Change-Id: I879b0410fd1f2f42657517c2ae435dd4681f8c8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/75/867675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

If not provided will use limit provided by instance's server_side_retries if server_side_retries_left is None: server_side_retries_left = self._server_side_retries and server_side_retries_left > 0): 'GET request, retrying after %d seconds. Retries ' 'left %d.', e, self._server_side_retries_delay, server_side_retries_left) server_side_retries_left -= 1 return self._op( method, path, data=data, headers=headers, blocking=blocking, timeout=timeout, server_side_retries_left=server_side_retries_left, **extra_session_req_kwargs)
deleted_lines: timeout=60, **extra_session_req_kwargs): and self._server_side_retries > 0): 'GET request, retrying after %d seconds', e, self._server_side_retries) self._server_side_retries -= 1 return self._op(method, path, data=data, headers=headers, blocking=blocking, timeout=timeout, **extra_session_req_kwargs)

commit_message:
[SVf] Optimize lsmdiskgrp calls in creation of replicated volumes

[Spectrum Virtualize family] During creation of replicated volumes,
lsmdiskgrp calls are made at L919 in storwize_svc_common.py file as
the secondary pools information is not available in stats. 

Hence, Optimized the lsmdiskgrp SSH calls to reduce the computational
time by storing the secondary pools information in stats.

Closes-Bug: #1978290
Change-Id: Iea7a7b7d7ce226b3c29aba9641b052ee7fe8614f

fix it where necessary and fix pylint version.

commit_message:
Comment out the upgrades jobs

This is needed in order to fix the content-provider jobs, broken on both
master and Zed.

Once the fix is merged in both branch, we'll be able to revert this
single patch.

Change-Id: Ie54d2c80b34e0e3e10389b75156f2b818caf01e4
Related-Bug: #2001626

commit_message:
Run security group api tests against stateless security groups too

With this patch most of the API tests related to Security groups will be
run for the default (stateful) security groups and also for stateless
security groups by passing "stateful=False" to the
create_security_group() function.

Change-Id: I66af24513ba126c1cd00ca896bbd56a448faf726
